free_text.Note: This course is also proposed to the PhD students of the Neuroscience (EDNE) and of the Cancer and Infection (EDCI) Programs.[br/][br/]Max. 16 students accepted (waiting list available)
free_text.Prerequisite for: NE-020-Part I. Basic Stem Cell course (EDNE-006 or equiv.)
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic Stem Cell Course or equivalent
free_text.Content: The following issues (list not limitative) will be raised: nuclear reprogramming, embryonic stem cells, tissue stem cells, stem cell plasticity, stem cell niche, cell and gene therapy, cancer and stem cells
free_text.Keywords: stem, cell developmental biology, cancer, cell therapy
free_text.Learning outcomes: This course follows the basic stem cell course. The objective is to develop a critical reading to distuinguish fantasies from realities by in-depth discussion of the latest development in stem cell research. Stem cell patentability, stem cell commercialization and ethics will be discussed.

free_text.Remarque: course opened to EPFL and UNIL graduate students. Maximum 16 students accepted
free_text.Prérequis: Basic Stem Cell Course or equivalent
free_text.Mots clés: stem, cell developmental biology, cancer, cell therapy
free_text.Contenu: The following issues (list not limitative) will be raised: nuclear reprogramming, embryonic stem cells, tissue stem cells, stem cell plasticity, stem cell niche, cell and gene therapy, cancer and stem cells
free_text.Préparation pour: NE-020-Part I. Basic Stem Cell course (EDNE-006 or equiv.)
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: This course follows the basic stem cell course. The objective is to develop a critical reading to distuinguish fantasies from realities by in-depth discussion of the latest development in stem cell research. Stem cell patentability, stem cell commercialization and ethics will be discussed.
